newsitem.title: USA: Aeroquip-Vickers sees industrial unit growth.
newsitem.headline: Aeroquip-Vickers sees industrial unit growth.

text.p: Aeroquip-Vickers Inc said Thursday it expected improved sales and margins in its industrial business.

"We had strong operating results from each of our three segments -- industrial, automotive and aerospace," Darryl Allen, chairman, president and chief executive said in a statement in which the company announced its second-quarter results.
"We are confident that, just as our strategies have been successful in aerospace and automotive, we are going to be successful in growing sales and margins in our industrial business," he said.

Industrial sales climbed 8.5 percent in the second three months of 1997 to a quarterly high of $317.5 million. The segment's operating margin was 10.3 percent, declining slightly from 11 percent in the year-earlier period because of general weakness in Europe and an unfavorable product mix in the United States, Aeroquip said.
The company posted second-quarter earnings of $1.15 per share compared with $1.11 in the year-earlier period. Sales rose 7.4 percent to $556.3 million from 517.9 million.
